Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

>>   I've posted it here some time ago. Your example is missing the test
>> name:
>>
>> public DataDrivenTest(int i) {
>>     super("testFoo");
>>     this.i = i;
>> }
> 
> What's the justification for this?

   Justification? This is just how JUnit resolve test cases.

   When TestCase subclass is created by implicit test suite like 
TestSuite.addTestSuite(Class) it would introspect all the test methods, 
and will instantiate TestSuite class using constructor with name. So, 
when creating suite with addTest(Test) method you just have to do the same.

   regards,
   Eugene
